meta.name: Return to Night of the Zealot - Custom Investigator Expansion
meta.description: A complete rework of the 5 core investigators, featuring 115 new cards: 5 investigators with unique signatures, 8 level 0 and 8 upgraded cards for each class, 11 neutral cards, and 3 basic weaknesses.
meta.author: seymour9297

cards.back_flavor: Roland had always taken comfort in procedure and rules. As an agent in the Bureau, he was relieved to have guidelines to follow in any given situation. But lately, his Federal Agent's Handbook had been entirely unhelpful given the cases he'd been assigned. Try as he might, Roland could find no mention of what to do when confronted with strange creatures, gates through time and space, or magic spells. If he hadn't seen it with his own eyes, he would never have believed it... and there's no way his superiors would understand.
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Guardian cards ([guardian]) level 0-5, Seeker cards ([seeker]) level 0-2, Neutral cards level 0-5. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Roland's .38 Special, Cover Up, 1 random basic weakness.
cards.flavor: "If I stir up trouble, Sheriff, it will be because there's trouble to stir up."
cards.name: Roland Banks
cards.text: [reaction] After you successfully investigate: You may place 1 ammo token on a Firearm asset you control. (Limit once per round.) [elder_sign] effect: +1. You may spend 1 ammo from an asset you control to discover 1 clue at your location.

cards.name: Roland's .38 Special
cards.text: Roland Banks deck only. Uses (4 ammo). [action] Spend 1 ammo: Fight. You get +2 [combat] for this attack. As part of this action, you may place 1 of your clues on your location. If you do, this attack deals +2 damage. If this attack defeats an enemy and you have no clues, discover 1 clue at your location.

cards.name: Cover Up
cards.text: Roland Banks deck only. Revelation - Put Cover Up into play in your threat area. If an enemy has been defeated this round, you cannot discover clues until the end of the round. [action][action] Place 1 of your clues on your location: Discard Cover Up.

cards.back_flavor: As a respected librarian at Miskatonic University, Daisy had always felt that books were the most important thing in her life. She explored in fiction what she abhorred in life: horror, violence, fear. Then, she stumbled across the John Dee translation of the Necronomicon. It was blasphemous, unholy, and too awful to be read. But given her studies in obscure and occult subjects, Daisy knew there was more truth than fiction within the book's pages. She began to wonder what other secrets the restricted collection of the Orne Library held...
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Seeker cards ([seeker]) level 0-5, up to five Mystic ([mystic]) cards level 0-1, up to five Survivor ([survivor]) cards level 0-1, Neutral cards level 0-5. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Daisy’s Tote Bag, The Necronomicon (John Dee Translation), 1 random basic weakness.
cards.name: Daisy Walker
cards.text:
[reaction] When you would discover 1 or more clues from an investigate ability on an event or asset: Look at the top 2 cards of the encounter deck. You may choose 1 to place on the bottom of the encounter deck. Return the rest to the top of the encounter deck in any order. (Limit once per round.)
[elder_sign] effect: +0. Choose an investigator at your location. That investigator discards a non-weakness treachery card from his or her threat area.

cards.name: Daisy's Tote Bag
cards.text: Daisy Walker deck only. [reaction] After Daisy's Tote Bag enters play: Discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until 4 non-Elite cards are discarded. Place those cards face up beneath this card. [reaction] When an investigator at your location would draw a card from the encounter deck: You may instead reveal a card from beneath Daisy’s Tote Bag. That investigator resolves that card's effects as if it were just drawn. Then, if this ability has been used [per_investigator] times, discard all remaining cards beneath Daisy’s Tote Bag.

cards.name: The Necronomicon
cards.text: Daisy Walker deck only. Revelation - Put The Necronomicon into play in your threat area. While The Necronomicon is in play, revelation effects on non-weakness treachery cards you draw resolve twice. [reaction] After you successfully investigate: Place 1 secret on The Necronomicon. Then, if there are 3 or more secrets on it, discard The Necronomicon.

cards.back_flavor: Skids hadn't planned on a life of crime. But sometimes doing the right thing means getting your hands dirty. His cellmate, Brad Hollins, would rant and rave about the "Old Ones". Skids didn't give it much thought until the night he woke to the sight of his cellmate bursting into flames. When Skids was finally released, he returned to Arkham, looking for answers.
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Secondary Class Choice: At deck creation, choose Guardian ([guardian]), or Survivor ([survivor]). Deckbuilding Options: Rogue cards ([rogue]) level 0-5, up to 10 other level 0-2 of your chosen secondary class, Neutral cards level 0-5. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): On the Lam, Hospital Debts, 1 random basic weakness.
cards.flavor: "I'm not proud of the shortcuts I've taken in life, but I never regretted a single one."
cards.name: "Skids" O'Toole
cards.text:
You may take an additional action each turn to play a card that costs 3 or more resources.
[elder_sign] effect: +1. Gain resources equal to the amount of actions you have taken this round (to a maximum of 4).

cards.name: On the Lam
cards.text: "Skids" O'Toole deck only. On the Lam comes into play with 2 resources on it. Forced - At the end of your turn: Place 1 resource on On the Lam for each action you took beyond 3 this round. [free] During your turn, Exhaust On the Lam: Move all resources from On the Lam to your resource pool. If you moved 5 or more resources this way, you may take 1 additional action this turn.

cards.name: Hospital Debts
cards.text: "Skids" O'Toole deck only. Revelation - Put Hospital Debts into play in your threat area, with 3 resources on it. Each time you play a card, increase the cost of that card by 2 and remove 1 resource from Hospital Debts. Then, if there are no more resources on Hospital Debts, discard it.

cards.back_flavor: Agnes Baker may be just an unassuming waitress in this life, but in a previous life, in a time and age undreamed of in the modern world, she had been a powerful witch. It began when she found a strange artifact - a key of some kind - in a dusty collection of family belongings in her attic. When she touched it, the memories came flooding back, along with one word: "Hyperborea." The more she delved into the visions and memories of her former life, the stronger her powers grew... and the more frightened she became.
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 25. Deckbuilding Options: Mystic cards ([mystic]) level 0-5, cards with "seal" level 0-5, Neutral cards level 0-5. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Heirloom of Hyperborea, Dark Memory, 1 random basic weakness.
cards.name: Agnes Baker
cards.text:
[reaction] When a chaos token is sealed on a card you control:
- If the sealed token has a negative modifier, deal 1 damage to an enemy at your location. (Limit once per round.)
- If the sealed token has a positive modifier, discover 1 clue at your location. (Limit once per round.)
[elder_sign] effect: +1. You may release a chaos token sealed on a card you control. Then, you may choose and seal a different non-[auto_fail] chaos token on that card.

cards.name: Heirloom of Hyperborea
cards.text:
Agnes Baker deck only.
Uses (1 charge).
[reaction] When a chaos token is sealed on a card you control: Place 1 charge on Heirloom of Hyperborea. (Limit once per phase.)
[reaction] When a chaos token is revealed that is a copy of a token sealed on a card you control, exhaust Heirloom of Hyperborea and spend 1 charge: Cancel that chaos token.

cards.name: Dark Memory
cards.text: Agnes Baker deck only. Revelation - Put Dark Memory into play in your threat area. Forced - When a chaos token is revealed from the chaos bag that is a copy of a token sealed on a card you control: That test automatically fails. Then, place 1 horror on Dark Memory. If Dark Memory has 3 or more horror on it, you may move all horror from it to Agnes Baker to discard Dark Memory

cards.back_flavor: Mama used to let Wendy play with her necklace when she was small. Mama would tell her stories, and Wendy would spin the necklace and watch as it glittered. Then, word came that her father had been lost at sea, and Mama started acting strange, drawing unusual symbols in chalk all over the house. They took Mama to the asylum, and Wendy went to the orphanage. Before they took her away, Mama gave her the necklace, to "protect her." Wendy stayed in the orphanage for several years before running away, deciding that she could take better care of herself on her own.
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Survivor cards ([survivor]) level 0-3, Fortune cards level 0-3, Mystic cards ([mystic]) level 0-2, Neutral cards level 0-5. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Wendy's Amulet, Abandoned and Alone, 1 random basic weakness.
cards.flavor: "My luck will turn around one day, I know it will."
cards.name: Wendy Adams
cards.text: [reaction] After you play or commit a Fortune card: You may return it to your hand instead of discarding it. (Limit once per round.) [elder_sign] effect: +1. You may return a Fortune card from your discard pile to your hand.

cards.name: Wendy's Amulet
cards.text: Wendy Adams deck only. Uses (0 charges). [reaction] After you play or commit a Fortune card: Place 2 charges on Wendy's Amulet (to a maximum of 6). [free] Spend X charges and exhaust Wendy's Amulet: Reveal the top X cards of your deck. Set aside any Fortune cards revealed this way. Shuffle your deck. Until the end of the round, you may play or commit those cards as if they were in your hand. At the end of the round, shuffle any set-aside cards back into your deck.

cards.name: Abandoned and Alone
cards.text: Wendy Adams deck only. Revelation - Put Abandoned and Alone into play in your threat area. While Abandoned and Alone is in play, the text box of each Fortune card you control is considered blank (except for Traits). [action] Take 1 horror and discard the top 3 cards of your deck: If at least 1 of them is a Fortune card, discard Abandoned and Alone.

cards.name: Ithaca 37.
cards.text: Uses (3 ammo). [action] Spend 1 ammo: Fight. You get +1 [combat] for this attack. This attack deals +1 damage. You may spend 1 additional ammo as part of this action. If you do, and this attack succeeds, deal 2 damage to a different enemy at your location with a fight value equal to or lower than the attacked enemy.

cards.name: Marked for Exposure
cards.text: [free] Exhaust Marked for Exposure and place 1 of your clues on your location: Choose an enemy at your location. That enemy gets –1 fight and –1 evade until the end of the round.

cards.name: Patrol Officer
cards.text: [reaction] When Patrol Officer enters play: Choose an enemy at your location or a connecting location. Move to that enemy’s location and engage it. Until the end of the round, ignore the retaliate keyword when attacking that enemy.

cards.name: Armor Piercing Rounds
cards.text: Uses (2 ammo). Attach to a Firearm asset you control. [action] Spend 1 ammo: Resolve an [action] ability on the attached asset, ignoring all costs. If a Fight action is performed against an enemy with a fight value of 4 or more, this attack deals +2 damage.

cards.flavor: “Let that be a warning.”
cards.name: Lethal Lesson
cards.text: Fast. Play only if you have defeated at least 1 enemy this round. During the enemy phase this round, non-Elite enemies cannot attack you or move into your location.

cards.flavor: If they didn’t want me breaking things, they shouldn’t have hidden the evidence under the floorboards.
cards.name: Pull the Place Apart
cards.text: Investigate. You may investigate using [combat] instead [intellect]. If this test is successful, take 1 damage and discover 1 additional clue at your location.

cards.name: Resourcefulness
cards.text:
Fast. As an additional cost to play this card, discard an asset you control.
Play an asset from your hand, reducing its cost by X, where X is the printed cost of the discarded asset.

cards.flavor: "Now look at what I found here..."
cards.name: Looting
cards.text: If this skill test is successful, replenish up to 2 ammo or supply tokens on an asset you control.

cards.name: Gear Assignment
cards.text: Attach to an Ally asset you control. You have 1 additional hand slot, which can only be used to hold Item assets. [reaction] When Gear Assignment enters play: You may play an Item asset from your hand, without paying for its cost.

cards.name: Ithaca 37.
cards.text: Uses (3 ammo). [action] Spend 1 ammo: Fight. You get +2 [combat] for this attack. This attack deals +1 damage. If this attack succeeds, for each point you succeeded by, you may deal 1 damage (to a maximum of 2) to a different enemy at your location with a fight value equal to or lower than the attacked enemy.

cards.name: Marked for Exposure
cards.text: [free] Exhaust Marked for Exposure and place 1 of your clues on your location: Choose an enemy at your location. Until the end of the round, that enemy gets –1 fight, –1 evade, and takes 1 additional damage each time it is dealt damage.

cards.name: Trench Knife
cards.text: Engage actions you perform do not provoke attacks of opportunity. [action]: Fight. You get +X [combat] for this attack. X is the number of enemies engaged with you. [reaction] When you engage an enemy, exhaust Trench Knife: Trigger its [action] ability without paying for its cost.

cards.name: Ward-etched Skin
cards.text:
Non-direct damage and non-direct horror assigned to you are considered direct damage and direct horror.
You get +1 [willpower], +2 health and +2 sanity.
[reaction] When you would be defeated by damage or horror, you may immediately discard Ward-etched Skin: Cancel up to 3 of that damage and/or horror.

cards.flavor: “Every corpse tells a story… and I know how to read them.”
cards.name: Evidence in Blood
cards.text: If this test is successful during an attack or while evading, discover 1 clue at your location for each enemy defeated this round (max 2 clues).

cards.name: Sister Aurelia
cards.text: [action] Exhaust Sister Aurelia: Heal 1 damage or 1 horror from an investigator or Ally asset at your location. [reaction] When one of your card effects heals damage and/or horror from any source: The next skill test performed at your location this round gets –X difficulty, where X is the total amount healed. (Limit once per round.)

cards.flavor: One shot to stagger, one shot to end it.
cards.name: Dual Wielding
cards.text: Fast. Play only during your turn if you control 2 Weapon assets. Resolve the [action] ability on each of those Weapon assets in any order, ignoring all [action] costs. For each skill test performed this way, you get +X [combat], where X is the total number of [combat] icons on both Weapon assets combined.

cards.name: Eldritch Insight
cards.text: Uses (4 charges and 1 secret). [action] Spend 1 charge: Investigate. Your location gets -1 shroud for each secret on this card for this investigation.

cards.name: Bookmark
cards.text: Fast. Play only during your turn. Attach to a Tome asset you control. Limit 1 per asset. [free] Exhaust Bookmark and the attached asset: You may contribute the icons of the attached asset to this skill test. If this test fails, discard Bookmark.

cards.flavor: "Aaaahhhhhhhh!" - Clearly panicking
cards.name: Flight or Fright
cards.text: Play only if you are engaged with an enemy. This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity. Take the following actions in any order: Move. Evade.

cards.name: Fortunate Find
cards.text:
Fast. Play when a [elder_sign], "+1," or "0" token is revealed during an investigation.
Choose an asset you control with uses (supply, charge, or secret). Ready that asset if it is exhausted. You may take 1 additional action this turn, which can only be used on an [action] ability on the chosen asset.

cards.name: Slip By
cards.text: Fast. Play when a non-Elite enemy would engage you with an evade value equal or lower than the number of clues you have. Until the end of the round, that enemy cannot engage you unless you take a non-Move action at its location.

cards.name: Two Steps Ahead
cards.text: Play only as your first action. This action does not cause attacks of opportunity. Put this card into play in your play area and search the chaos bag for a "0" or "+1" chaos token and seal it on this card. [reaction] When you or another investigator at your location would reveal a chaos token during a skill test: You may instead reveal the sealed token on this card. Then, release it. Forced - At the end of the round, if Two Steps Ahead is in your play area: Discard it.

cards.name: Inspect
cards.text:
If this test is successful, attach Inspect to the investigated location or evaded enemy.
While attached, Inspect contributes its skill icons to all investigators when investigating the attached location, or when evading the attached enemy.

cards.flavor: "Sometimes all you need is a different perspective to solve the problem."
cards.name: Vantage Point
cards.text: This card can only be committed to a skill test being performed by another investigator either at your location, or at a connecting location. If this skill test succeeds by 1 or more, return this card to your hand.

cards.name: Seed of Clarity
cards.text:
Exceptional. Fast.
[reaction] When Seed of Clarity enters play: Search your bonded cards for 1 copy of Revelation of Purpose and shuffle it into the encounter deck.
[reaction] When Revelation of Purpose is revealed: You may shuffle Seed of Clarity back into your deck and heal 1 horror.

cards.name: Revelation of Purpose
cards.text: Bonded (Seed of Clarity). Revelation - Search the top 6 cards of your deck. Choose 1 card to draw. Until the end of the round, reduce the cost of that card by 2. Shuffle the remaining cards back into your deck. Then, set this card aside out of play.

cards.flavor:
To step between the moments is to walk unseen—
and to walk unseen is to be free.
cards.name: Slipstream Theorem
cards.text: [action] Exhaust Slipstream Theorem: Investigate. This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity. If you succeed, instead of discovering clues, automatically evade an enemy at your location.

cards.name: Fortunate Find
cards.text:
Fast. Play when a [elder_sign], "+1," or "0" token is revealed during an investigation.
Choose an asset you control with uses (supply, charge, or secret). Ready that asset if it is exhausted. Place either 1 supply, charge or secret on that asset. You may take 1 additional action this turn, which can only be used on an [action] ability on the chosen asset.

cards.name: Pattern Recognition
cards.text: Fast. Name a Trait. Look at the top card of the encounter deck. If it has the named Trait, discard it. Then, search the encounter deck for any number of cards with the same title and discard them. Shuffle the encounter deck.

cards.flavor: Wisdom is not a product of schooling but of the lifelong attempt to acquire it.
cards.name: Seeking Knowledge
cards.text:
Limit 1 per investigator.
[reaction] After you enter a location with 4 or more shroud, exhaust Seeking Knowledge: immediately take a basic action.

cards.name: Archivist's Lens
cards.text:
Fast. Uses (2 secrets).
[reaction] After you look at 1 or more cards from the encounter deck or your deck, exhaust Archivist's Lens: Place 1 charge on it (max 3).
[action] Spend 3 secrets: Discover 2 clues at your location or heal 2 horror from an investigator at your location.

cards.name: Eldritch Insight
cards.text: Uses (4 charges and 3 secrets). [action] Spend 1 charge: Investigate. Your location gets -1 shroud for each secret on this card for this investigation. [free] During a skill test you are performing: Spend 1 secret to gain +1 to any skill value for this test.

cards.name: Deduction
cards.text:
If this skill test is successful while investigating a location, resolve the following based on how much you exceed the skill test by:
- By 0-1: Discover 1 additional clue at your location.
- By 2: Discover 2 additional clues at your location.
- By 3 or more: Discover 2 additional clues at your location or a connecting location.

cards.name: Molly Brown
cards.text: [reaction] When Molly Brown enters play: Gain 2 resources for each other Ally asset you control. [reaction] When Molly Brown leaves play: Choose an Ally asset in your discard pile. Return it to your hand.

cards.name: Flash of Wealth
cards.text:
Fast. Play only if you spent 5 or more resources this round.
Search the top X cards of your deck for a card, where X is the number of resources spent this round, and add it to your hand. Shuffle your deck.

cards.flavor: "I don't fight fair. I don't have to."
cards.name: Intimidate
cards.text: Evade. This evasion attempt uses [combat] instead of [agility]. If you succeed by 2 or more, until the end of the round, you get +2 skill value while performing skill tests during attacks against that enemy.

cards.name: Last Ditch Effort
cards.text: As an additional cost to play Last Ditch Effort, place 1 of your clues on your location. Investigate. If this test is successful, discover 2 additional clues at your location.

cards.name: Lucky Strike
cards.text: Fast. Play when an enemy makes an attack of opportunity against you. Cancel that attack. Evade. Attempt to evade the attacking enemy. If you succeed, and deal 1 damage to it.

cards.name: Smoke Bomb
cards.text: Attach this card to your location. When you play Smoke Bomb, disengage all enemies from investigators at your location. Enemies at attached location cannot engage investigators and cannot move from this location. Investigators at attached location get -2 to all skill tests. Forced - At the end of the round, if Smoke Bomb is attached to a location: Discard it.

cards.name: "Keep Blastin'"
cards.text: Commit only to a skill test during an attack with a Firearm asset. If this skill test is successful, you may deal 2 damage to another enemy at your location.

cards.flavor: When you’ve hit rock bottom, the only way is up.
cards.name: Rock Bottom
cards.text:
While you have 1 or fewer resources, you may commit this card from your discard pile. 
After resolving the skill test, if this card was committed from the discard pile, place it at the bottom of your deck.

cards.name: Bribed Silence
cards.text:
Fast. As an additional cost to play this card, spend up to 6 resources.
Chose an enemy at your location. For each 2 resources spent, resolve the following effects in order:
- Until the end of the round, the next time that enemy attacks, cancel that attack.
- Until the end of the round, investigators ignore the alert and retaliate keywords on that enemy.
- Disengage from that enemy and move up to two locations away.

cards.flavor: If anyone asks, you were never there.
cards.name: Inside Job
cards.text:
Fast.
As an additional cost to play Inside Job, ready an exhausted enemy at your location.
Discover up to 2 clues from your location.

cards.name: Last Ditch Effort
cards.text: As an additional cost to play Last Ditch Effort, place 1 of your clues on your location. Investigate. You may investigate using [agility] instead of [intellect]. If this test is successful, discover 2 additional clues at your location or a connecting location. If you succeed by 2 or more, discover 3 additional clues instead.

cards.name: Negotiations
cards.text: Parley. Reveal a random chaos token from the chaos bag. If you revealed: - A positive number or [elder_sign] token: Play a card from your hand without paying for it's cost. - A negative number: Search your deck or discard pile for a Illicit or Criminal card and add it to your hand. Shuffle your deck. - A non-[elder_sign] symbol token: Either discard 2 cards or 3 resources.

cards.name: Bloodwire
cards.text:
Limit 1 per investigator.
[reaction] After an enemy readies at your location: Deal 1 damage to that enemy. If that enemy is defeated by this effect, gain 1 resource. (Limit once per enemy per round.)

cards.name: Burglary
cards.text: [action] Exhaust Burglary: Investigate. This investigation uses [agility] instead of [intellect]. If you succeed, instead of discovering clues, gain 2 resources, +1 additional resource for each point you succeed by (to a maximum of +3 resources).

cards.name: Stolen Idol of Yoth
cards.text: Exceptional. Uses (0 secrets). [reaction] When you play Stolen Idol of Yoth, seal a non-[auto_fail] chaos token of your choice from the token pool (not the chaos bag) on this card. [reaction] After you reveal an identical chaos token to the one sealed on this card: Place 1 secret on Stolen Idol of Yoth. (Limit once per phase.) Forced - When the game ends: Gain 1 additional experience for each secret on Stolen Idol of Yoth (maximum 5).

cards.name: Flash of Wealth
cards.text:
Fast. Play only if you spent 5 or more resources this round.
Search the top X cards of your deck for a card, where X is the number of resources spent this round, and add it to your hand. Shuffle your deck. Then, repeat this process two more times. You may immediately play 1 of those cards.

cards.name: Eyes Through the Veil
cards.text: Uses (5 charges). [action] If Eyes Through the Veil is ready, spend 1 charge: Investigate. Investigate using [willpower] instead of [intellect]. After you reveal a chaos token for this test, you may reveal 1 additional token. If you revealed an additional token this way and the test is successful, discover 1 additional clue at your location. If a non-[elder_sign] symbol token is revealed during this test, exhaust Eyes Through the Veil.

cards.name: Master of Secrets
cards.text: [reaction] After an investigation skill test you perform ends, exhaust Master of Secrets: If no token is sealed on this card, you may seal the revealed non-[auto_fail] token. If you seal a "+0", "+1" or [elder_sign] token this way, discover 1 clue at your location. Forced - At the end of the round, if Master of Secrets has a sealed token on it: You must either place 1 of your clues on your location or release that token.

cards.flavor: The words within turn fury into drowsy whispers.
cards.name: Soporific Grimoire
cards.text: [action] Exhaust Soporific Grimoire: Parley. Choose an enemy at your location. Test [intellect] (X), where X is the enemy's fight value. If this test is successful, exhaust that enemy. (It does not disengage)

cards.name: Tattoos of the Void
cards.text: [reaction] When a chaos token is sealed on another card you control and Tattoos of the Void has no sealed tokens on it: You may seal an identical token on Tattoos of the Void. Forced - At the start of the round, if Tattoos of the Void has a sealed token and the matching token on the other card has been released: You must either take 1 horror or release the token sealed on Tattoos of the Void.

cards.flavor: "I will bear your pain, for I have walked through darkness before."
cards.name: Burden of Souls
cards.text:
Fast.
Move up to 3 horror from an investigator at your location onto you and/or assets you control, split in any way. For each horror moved this way, deal 1 damage to an enemy at your location.

cards.name: Inscription of Power
cards.text: Attach to your location. Attached location cannot be investigated. Each non-Elite enemy at the attached location gets -1 fight and -1 evade. Forced - If there are no investigators at attached location, discard Inscription of Power.

cards.flavor: Power never vanishes. It only finds a new shape.
cards.name: Spellshifting
cards.text:
Fast.
Move up to 3 charges from one asset you control, onto another asset at your location. For each charge moved this way, gain 1 resource.

cards.flavor: The magic lingers, ready to be woven anew.
cards.name: Imbue
cards.text: If this test is successful during a skill test from an ability printed on a Spell asset you control, attach Imbue to that Spell asset. The attached asset gains: "[action] Discard Imbue: Return this asset to your hand."

cards.name: Bind the Pulse of Time
cards.text:
Fast. Play only during your turn if you sealed, canceled, or ignored 1 or more chaos tokens this round.
Choose an asset you control that has an [action] ability with an Investigate, Fight, or Evade action. Resolve that ability, ignoring all costs.

cards.name: Price of Clarity
cards.text:
As an additional cost to commit Price of Clarity to a skill test, take up to 3 horror. For each horror you take in this way, Price of Clarity gains a [wild] for this test.
If you have 3 or less sanity after this test resolves, heal 2 horror.

cards.name: Forbidden Knowledge
cards.text: Uses (4 secrets). If Forbidden Knowledge has no secrets, discard it. [free] Exhaust Forbidden Knowledge and take 1 horror: Move 1 secret from Forbidden Knowledge to your resource pool, as a resource. Forced - After Forbidden Knowledge leaves play, heal 2 horror and draw 2 cards.

cards.name: Vessel of Agonies
cards.text:
Uses (0 charges).
[reaction] After you take 1 or more horror: Place 1 charge on Vessel of Agonies (max once per phase).
[free] If Vessel of Agonies has 5 or more charges on it: Deal 5 damage to an enemy at your location. Then, discard Vessel of Agonies.

cards.name: Drawn by Prophecy
cards.text: Investigate. Investigate using [willpower] instead of [intellect]. When this skill test begins, name a chaos token. Reveal 3 chaos tokens and choose 1 of them to resolve for this test. If the chosen token is the named token, discover 2 additional clues at your location. For each non-[elder_sign] symbol token revealed during this test, lose 1 resource.

cards.name: Blessing of the Occult
cards.text: Uses (5 charges). If Blessing of the Occult has no charges, discard it. [reaction] After you reveal a non-[auto_fail] token, spend 1 charge: Treat that token as a [skull] token instead. Forced - After Blessing of the Occult leaves play: Each investigator at your location or a connecting location may choose to either heal 1 horror or draw 1 card.

cards.name: Eyes Through the Veil
cards.text: Uses (5 charges). [action] If Eyes Through the Veil is ready, spend 1 charge: Investigate. Investigate using [willpower] instead of [intellect]. Your location gets -2 shroud for this investigation. After you reveal the initial chaos token for this test, you may choose to reveal up to 2 additional chaos tokens, one at a time. If the test succeeds, for each additional token revealed this way, you may discover 1 additional clue at your location. If a non-[elder_sign] symbol token is revealed during this test, exhaust Eyes Through the Veil.

cards.name: Inscription of Power
cards.text:
Attach to your location. Attached location cannot be investigated.
Attached location gains "[action]: Test [willpower] (5). If you succeed, return Inscription of Power to its owner's hand. Any investigator at this location may activate this ability."
Each investigator at the attached location gets +2 [willpower]. Each enemy at the attached location gets -2 fight and -2 evade.

cards.name: Lumberjack's Axe
cards.text: [action] If Lumberjack's Axe is ready: Fight. For each previous time you have used this ability this round, you get an additional +1 [combat] and deal +1 damage (to a maximum of +2 [combat] and +2 damage). Forced - After you resolve the [action] ability on Lumberjack’s Axe for the third time in a round: Exhaust Lumberjack’s Axe. It does not ready during your next upkeep phase.

cards.flavor: Sometimes, the house fights back.
cards.name: Nailed Board
cards.text: Nailed Board can be played from your discard pile. [action]: Fight. You get +1 [combat] for this attack. This attack deals +1 damage. If you succeed, discard Nailed Board after the attack resolves.

cards.flavor: "Good boy, Rex! Always knows just what I need, even when I don’t."
cards.name: Rex, Trusty Retriever
cards.text:
Uses (4 dog treats).
[reaction] After a skill test succeeds by 2 or more, if you or another investigator at your location committed a level 0–2 skill card to that test, exhaust Rex, Trusty Retriever and spend 1 dog treat: Return that skill card to its owner’s hand.

cards.name: Ergonomic Grip
cards.text: Attach to a Melee asset you control. Limit 1 per asset. [reaction] Exhaust Ergonomic Grip and the attached asset: Resolve an [action] ability on the attached asset, ignoring it's [action] cost.

cards.flavor: “Wasn’t much of a legacy, but it’s enough.”
cards.name: "It Ain't Over"
cards.text: Fast. Play after an Ally asset at your location is discarded or is defeated. Search your discard pile for an Item asset and add it to your hand.

cards.name: Night Camp
cards.text: Play only if there are no enemies at your location. Attach to your location. Attached location gains "[action]: Heal 1 damage or 1 horror. Any investigator at this location may activate this ability. (Limit once per turn.)" Forced - After an enemy enters the attached location, discard Night Camp.

cards.flavor: What was lost can always be found, with a little bit of luck.
cards.name: From the Ashes
cards.text:
Max 1 committed per skill test.
If this skill test fails, return this card to your hand. You cannot commit this card to another skill test this round.

cards.flavor: Sometimes you play for keeps. Sometimes you just play to stay in the game.
cards.name: Gambler's Resolve
cards.text:
Max 1 committed per skill test.
If this test is successful, gain 2 resources and discard the top card of your deck. If you fail, discard the top 3 cards of your deck.

cards.flavor: "Smells like fish guts and mildew. Saved my skin more times than I can count."
cards.name: Weathered Oilskin
cards.text:
You get +1 health and +1 sanity.
[reaction] After you successfully move while engaged with an enemy, exhaust Weathered Oilskin: Automatically evade that enemy.

cards.name: Clear the Deck
cards.text:
Fast. You may play Clear the Deck from your discard pile. If you do, shuffle it into your deck after resolving its effects.
As an additional cost to play Clear the Deck, you may discard up to 5 cards from your hand. Reduce this card’s cost by 1 for each card discarded this way. Draw 1 card for each card discarded this way, plus 1.

cards.flavor: Threads of fate do not fray without reason.
cards.name: Frayed Token
cards.text: [reaction] When one of your card effects discards a card from your hand or play area, exhaust Frayed Token: Shuffle the discarded card into your deck and draw 1 card. (Limit once per round.)

cards.flavor: He never came if you called for him. It always seemed like he had his own agenda.
cards.name: Stray Cat
cards.text: You get +1 [agility]. [free] Discard Stray Cat: Choose a non-Elite enemy at your location. Shuffle that enemy into the encounter deck.

cards.name: Ergonomic Grip
cards.text: Attach to a Melee asset you control. Limit 1 per asset. [reaction] Exhaust Ergonomic Grip and the attached asset: Resolve an [action] ability on the attached asset, ignoring it's [action] cost. You get +1 [combat] for this skill test and deal +1 damage.

cards.name: Planted Evidence
cards.text:
Fast. Play after you successfully evade an  enemy. 
Attach Planted Evidence to that enemy. Limit 1 per enemy.
[reaction] If an investigator at this enemy’s location discovers 1 or more clues: Discover 1 additional clue. (Limit once per round.)

cards.name: Junkyard Instinct
cards.text:
Limit 1 per investigator. While Junkyard Instinct is in play in your play area, the first card you play from your discard pile each round costs 1 fewer resource.
[free] Discard Junkyard Instinct: Play a card from your discard pile. Reduce its cost by 1.

cards.name: Tenacious Resolve
cards.text:
Max 1 committed per skill test.
While Tenacious Resolve is in your discard pile, if you add another card from your discard pile to your hand or play a card from your discard pile: Return Tenacious Resolve to your hand.  (Max once per round.)

cards.name: Bait
cards.text: Uses (2 supplies). [action] Spend 1 supply: Parley. Automatically evade a non-Elite Monster or Creature enemy engaged with an investigator at your location.

cards.name: Bound to You
cards.text:
Permanent. Limit 1 per deck. Purchase only at deck creation.
Before drawing your opening hand, search your deck for your signature card and add it to your hand. Then shuffle your deck and draw 4 cards as your opening hand.
You may not mulligan cards in your opening hand. Weaknesses drawn this way must remain in your hand.

cards.name: Collateral Damage
cards.text: Permanent. Group limit 1 in play. Purchase only at deck creation. When an investigator performs a Fight action against an enemy engaged with another investigator, that skill test gets +1 difficulty. If the attack fails, the engaged investigator may test [agility] (X), where X is the amount the attack failed by. If they succeed, the engaged investigator takes no damage from the failed attack.

cards.flavor: Tucked behind a false panel in the library wall, the parchment was brittle with age, and brimming with revelation.
cards.name: Forgotten Blueprint
cards.text: [action] Exhaust Forgotten Blueprint and another non-permanent neutral asset you control: Draw 2 cards. If you exhausted Old Schematics, you may instead draw 3 cards, then choose and discard a card from your hand.

cards.flavor: Each scribbled note told of a shortcut long forgotten… or wisely abandoned.
cards.name: Old Schematics
cards.text: [action] Exhaust Old Schematics and another non-permanent neutral asset you control: One a time, take up to 2 move actions. If you exhausted Forgotten Blueprint, this action does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

cards.name: Pact of Endurance
cards.text:
Permanent. Group limit 1 in play. Purchase only at deck creation.
When an investigator is dealt damage or horror, all of that damage or horror must be assigned to a single card.
If the chosen card does not have a printed health or sanity value (e.g. Leather Coat or Cherished Keepsake), then any portion of the damage or horror that cannot be assigned to the initially chosen card must be assigned to another card.
Excess damage or horror is not assigned elsewhere and is instead lost.

cards.name: Reversal of Signs
cards.text: Permanent. Group limit 1 in play. Purchase only at deck creation. [reaction] When a [auto_fail] is revealed during a skill test: Cancel that chaos token, return it to the token pool, and reveal another token. (Group limit once per game.) Forced - The first time a [elder_sign] token is revealed during a skill test this game: Cancel that chaos token, return it to the token pool, and reveal another token.

cards.name: The Thirteenth Appendix
cards.text:
Permanent. Limit 1 per deck. Purchase only at deck creation.
Your deck size is increased by 5. When you draw your opening hand, you may take an additional mulligan.

cards.name: Bait
cards.text: Uses (2 supplies). [action] Spend 1 supply: Parley. Automatically evade a non-Elite Monster or Creature enemy engaged with an investigator at your location. You may also move that enemy to a connecting location.

cards.name: Kukri
cards.text: [action]: Fight. You get +1 [combat] for this attack. This attack deals +1 damage. If you succeed, you may spend 1 additional action to deal 1 damage to an enemy at your location.

cards.name: Recursive Directive
cards.text:
Fast.
Resolve an [action] ability on two different neutral assets you control, ignoring all [action] costs.
If the chosen assets were Forgotten Blueprint and Old Schematics, add Recursive Directive to the victory display.

cards.name: Broken Seal
cards.text: Broken Seal can only be included in your deck if your deck contains at least 3 cards that take up one or more accessory or arcane slots. Revelation - Return all cards in play that take up accessory slots and arcane slots to your hand. Put Broken Seal into play in your threat area. It cannot leave play except by using the ability below. [action] Discard a card from your hand that takes up at least one accessory or arcane slot: Discard Broken Seal.

cards.name: Slippery Grip
cards.text: Slippery Grip can only be included in your deck if your deck contains at least 3 cards that take up one or more hand slots. Revelation - Return all cards in play that take up hand slots to your hand. Put Slippery Grip into play in your threat area. It cannot leave play except by using the ability below. [action] Discard a card from your hand that takes up at least one hand slot: Discard Slippery Grip.

cards.name: Turned Coat
cards.text: Turned Coat can only be included in your deck if your deck contains at least 3 cards that take up an ally slot. Revelation - Return all cards in play that take up an ally slot to your hand. Put Turned Coat into play in your threat area. It cannot leave play except by using the ability below. [action] Discard a card from your hand that takes up at least one ally slot: Discard Turned Coat.

cards.name: The Elder Sign
cards.text:
Permanent. Limit 1 per deck. Purchase only at deck creation. Uses (3 signs).
[free] If you are playing true solo, exhaust The Elder Sign and spend 1 sign. Choose one:
- Move to a connecting location.
- You get +2 skill value for your next skill test this round.
- Gain 1 additional action this turn, which may only be used to activate an [action] ability on a scenario card in play.
[free] Draw the top card of the encounter deck: Replenish 2 uses on The Elder Sign.

packs.name: Return to Night of the Zealot - Custom Investigator Expansion
